page.title: 14FARMING AND BUSINESS 2
page.content: ON THE BENINGBROUGH ESTATE THE HOME FARM AND LAND IS LEASED TO A FARMER. THE FARM IS MAINLY DAIRY WITH A 300 COW MILKING HERD PLUS FOLLOWERS. THE MILK PRODUCTION IS ABOUT 5,000 LITRES PER DAY FROM BRITISH HOLSTEIN COWS WHICH GRAZE THE PERMANENT PASTURE OF THE PARK IN SUMMER. A HUNDRED EWES ARE BROUGHT IN FOR WINTER. THE GARDENS REFLECT VARIOUS TRENDS.THE FORMER WALLED KITCHEN GARDEN IS USED AS A PICNIC AREA. THE AMERICAN GARDEN AND WILDERNESS ARE BOUNDED BY A HAHA. THE WEST FORMAL GARDEN HAS AN ELIZABETHAN KNOT GARDEN. THE EAST FORMAL HAS A 1920'S ATMOSPHERE. OTHER BORDERS HAVE GROUND COVER PLANTS OR MULCHES TO SAVE LABOUR. THERE ARE SEVERAL RARE TREES AND TWO INTERESTING GRAPE VINES FOSTERS SEEDLING AND LADY DOWN'S SEEDLING DEVELOPED IN 1835. THE GARDENS ATTRACT MANY VISITORS.
